#Text=2005 World Social Forum-Brazil coverage
#Text=The first day of the World Social Forum wraps up
#Text=Thursday , January 27 , 2005
#Text=Brazilian president Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has defended himself before over 15 000 activists at the World Social Forum in Porto Alegre .
#Text=He interrupted his speech to respond to hecklers by saying " Those of you that are n't from here , do n't be afraid .

#Text=There was a march called  March Against the Lies and the War of Bush " in protest against the American President George W. Bush .

column1: #Text=The Portuguese writer José Saramago suggested a more propositive WSF .
#Text=Third day
#Text=Saturday , January 29 , 2005

#Text=The Brazilian writer and former Catholic priest Leornado Boff identified what he termed the " Three Wounds " of Brazilian society : colonialism , the past of slavery and the transformation of the country by great multinational companies .
#Text=According to Boff , the Catholic Church does not have the right to talk about dignity because it is seated in the blood of millions .
#Text=He still defended that the first right is the right to the life and that other freedoms must come later , including the rights of freedom of movement and freedom of thought .

#Text=Finally Boff considered three criteria to judge the religious traditions that exist : " All tradition that implies in suffering of any person should be abolished ; all religion that violates the human rights must be abandoned ; and everything which means the breaking of the land , the water and the environment must be abolished . "
#Text=South America is the absolute priority of the Brazilian external politics according to the special assessor of external politics of the Presidency of the Republic , Marco Aurélio Garcia .
#Text=( audio )
#Text=Activists promoted a campaign against Coca-Cola .
#Text=According to them the Coca-Cola Company is responsible for contamination and crisis of the water supply , unemployment and deaths .
#Text=Conference with José Saramago , Eduardo Galeano and Ignácio Ramonet .
#Text=Conference with the Brazilian Minister of Culture Gilberto Gil about Free Software .
#Text=Fourth day
#Text=Sunday , January 30 , 2005
#Text=Professor Laurindo Leal , from School of Communication of the University of São Paulo ( USP ) defended the control of content in the broadcasting network .
#Text=He cited the USA , France , Germany , Canada , England as good examples how a broadcasting network model should work .
#Text=The President of Venezuela , Hugo Chavez , arrived .
#Text=Chavez said it is impossible to solve the severe problems of poverty in the world in Capitalism .
#Text=" Neither [ by ] Statism -- Capitalism of the State -- which would be the same Soviet perversion that was the cause of its destruction .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= However , we have the red kryptonite " , Chavez said .

column1: #Text=Chavez defended the control over the media by the State .
#Text=" The children cannot see this violence and the media cannot transmit calls to the terrorism " , he added .
#Text=Chavez met with the Landless Workers ' Movement ( MST ) .

#Text=The Brazilian Minister of Agrarian Development , Miguel Rossetto , said that the presence of the president of Venezuela , Hugo Chávez , is a homage to the people who try to construct Brazil in a different form .
#Text=Miguel Rossetto signed , with Chávez , a protocol of intentions for the interchange and reproduction of native seeds for the Brazilian and Venezuelan agriculturists .

#Text=The Minister and the President also signed a document that initiates the discussion about the creation of the Latin American School of AgroEcology in Brazil , following the model executed in Venezuela .
#Text=Fifth day : The closing of the World Social Forum 2005
#Text=Monday , January 31 , 2005
#Text=Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez said that the WSF is of paramount political importance .

#Text=He participated of a conference with the Brazilian Minister of the Cities Olívio Dutra , the governor of the Paraná Robert Requião , the President of the CUT labour union Marine Luiz , and the managing director of the monthly periodical Le Monde Diplomatique Ignacio Ramonet .
#Text=Activists protested against US President George W. Bush .
#Text=There was a farewell show , with musical presentations and of dance .
